key_risks: Regulatory and compliance issues, including a $10 million SEC settlement for internal control failures
Cybersecurity threats, including ransomware attacks targeting its Latin-American division
Low interest rate environment impacting profitability of life insurance and annuity products
Long-term liabilities from pension risk transfer deals
Reputation risks from past claims handling disputes and regulatory fines
controversies: $10 million SEC settlement for accounting errors in annuities businesses
Claims handling disputes and regulatory fines affecting reputation
social_issues: Focus on diversity and sustainability as part of ESG initiatives
governance_issues: Internal control failures leading to regulatory scrutiny
Cybersecurity vulnerabilities and potential data breaches

sources.title: Internal Control Failures Cost MetLife $10 million in SEC Settlement
sources.snippet: MetLife, Inc. has agreed to pay a civil penalty of $10 million in order to settle charges from the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") that it violated the books and records and internal accounting controls provisions of the federal securities laws. Read the full SEC Press Release Here. MetLife's Retirement and Income Solutions Error

sources.title: MetLife to Pay $10 Million for Longstanding Internal Control Failures
sources.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged MetLife, Inc. with violating the books and records and internal accounting controls provisions of the federal securities laws relating to two errors in its accounting for reserves associated with its annuities businesses. MetLife has agreed to pay $10 million to settle the charges.
